Abstract
Pruritus is a symptom found in patients with chronic
liver diseases, especially cholestatic liver diseases such
as primary biliary cholangitis. This symptom impairs
patient quality of life by disturbing sleep and may lead
to consideration of liver transplantation. Mechanisms
implicated in pruritus have been associated with the
peripheral and central nervous systems, leading to
the development of various therapeutic options. Little
evidence for the efficacy of most of these treatments
is currently available, indicating a need for further
investigations.
Key words: Pruritus; Cholestasis; Autotaxin; Opioid
receptor antagonist

Core tip:
Pruritus is a symptom influencing the quality
of life in patients with chronic liver diseases especially
with cholestatic liver diseases. Complex underlying
mechanisms have been identified and various
therapeutic options developed. More evidence is
needed for these treatments, as well as improvements
in their tolerability.
